title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the technology shown in Image 2 or Australia is more advanced.

Two points for describing the agricultural technology shown in Image 2 shows mechanized equipment that was derived from the innovations of the second agricultural revolution.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following comparisons of the methods of sugarcane production:
The response correctly states one of the following comparisons of the methods of sugarcane production:
The response correctly states one of the following comparisons of the methods of sugarcane production:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that globalization has increased transnational migration, or the consumption and/or transportation of sugarcane.

Two points for describing the globalization of the world economy or global culture has spread or diffused sugar production and/or consumption to most parts of the world or most culture regions from its hearth of domestication (Southeast Asia).
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways the process of globalization contributed to the diffusion of sugarcane from its hearth of domestication:
The response correctly states one of the following ways the process of globalization contributed to the diffusion of sugarcane from its hearth of domestication:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways the process of globalization contributed to the diffusion of sugarcane from its hearth of domestication:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that mechanical equipment combust/burn fuels which emit pollution.

Two points for describing how fuel combustion in mechanized equipment emits carbon dioxide, carbon monoxide, volatile organic compounds (VOC’s), and/or particulate matter which can pollute and effect the local and/or global atmosphere.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways how the type of sugarcane production shown in Image 2 may contribute to air pollution:
The response correctly states the following way how the type of sugarcane production shown in Image 2 may contribute to air pollution:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways how the type of sugarcane production shown in Image 2 may contribute to air pollution:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating the roles of women are unlikely to change.

Two points for explaining that women’s roles in rural areas or in developing countries often remain in secondary standing to men in society due to traditional cultural, economic, social and/or political power relationships.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways how women’s roles in society may be unlikely to change as an area transitions from subsistence farming to commercial farming:
The response correctly states one of the following ways how women’s roles in society may be unlikely to change as an area transitions from subsistence farming to commercial farming:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways how women’s roles in society may be unlikely to change as an area transitions from subsistence farming to commercial farming:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating trade has increased supply and/or decreased prices.

Two points for describing that increased supply and lower prices has made sugar widely consumable.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways how patterns of world trade may affect a developed country that consumes sugar:
The response correctly states one of the following ways how patterns of world trade may affect a developed country that consumes sugar:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways how patterns of world trade may affect a developed country that consumes sugar:
